entries.name: Age
entries: Flameveil reach adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century. Flameveils who merge with an elemental can live upwards of 300 years.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Flameveil society, with its clear devotion to their deity, has a strong lawful bent. Because of their isolation, they tend to lean more toward neutral.

entries.name: Size
entries: Flameveil take the shape of humans, and as such, they vary widely in height and build, from barely 5 feet to well over 6 feet tall. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Candle in the Dark
entries: You appear to be surrounded by a soft flickering candlelight that extends outwards 30 feet in all directions. As a bonus action, you can smother your flames and cause them to dim. Dimming your flames this way causes no visible light emit from your body, although up-close inspection will still reveal a faint flickering light.

entries.name: Heritage of the Flameveil
entries: You were born to the Eternal Hearth. As a flameveil, you are composed of the plane of fire's will and desireâ€”yet the flameveil were never a warlike race. On the contrary, they often fought defensively, protecting their land from clans such as the firenewt tribes and elementals which roamed their homeworld. As a child of the Eternal Hearth, you gain the following benefits:

items: You have two creature types: humanoid and elemental. You can be affected by a spell or ability that works on either of your creature types.

The first time you would be subjected to fire damage, you treat that attack as if you had immunity. Afterwards, your immunity transforms into resistance. This temporary immunity resets on a short or long rest.
You learn the {@spell control flames|xge} and {@spell produce flame} cantrips. Charisma is your spellcasting modifier for these spells.
For many millennia, your people have done battle with elementals, and you know their tricks. You have advantage on Constitution and Dexterity saving throws made to avoid or resist fire.

entries.name: Body of Flame
entries: While you appear humanoid on the offset, your true form is composed of extremely-dense fire which can be easily morphed into the visage of a human. That form can easily be dropped at a moment's notice, although it requires a decent bit of stamina to perform.

When you would be subject to a melee or ranged weapon attack, you can roll a Dexterity or Charisma saving throw (your choice) as a reaction with a DC equal to 8 + the creature's to-hit modifier. On a successful save, the attack misses. You can use this feature twice, and regain all expended uses on a long rest.

entries.name: Final Light
entries: Starting at 2nd level, upon reaching zero hit points, your body becomes one with the Eternal Hearth, and you explode into a fiery storm. Each hostile creature in a 30 feet radius must make a Dexterity saving throw equal to your 8 + your Charisma modifier + your proficiency bonus. On a failed save, they take {@dice 1d8} fire damage. For every two levels above 2, add an additional {@dice 1d8} fire damage. On a successful save, they instead take half damage. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Primordial.
